gmd:hierarchyLevelName.gco:CharacterString: Highest level of data collection, from a common set of sensors or instrumentation, usually within the same research project

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic Information - Metadata - Part 2: Extensions for Imagery and Gridded Data

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Seawater Nd isotopes and concentrations from the US-GEOTRACES North Atlantic zonal transect (NAZT), 2010 and 2011 on cruises KN199-04 and KN204-01

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: seawater Nd isotopes and concentrations from the US-GEOTRACES North Atlantic zonal transect (NAZT) Dataset Description: <p>These&nbsp;data are from the collaboration of three different institutes: The University of South Carolina (USC), the Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory (LDEO) of Columbia University and the University of Hawaii at Manoa (UH).</p><p>KN199-04 (GT10) data are publically available;<a href="http://data.bco-dmo.org/jg/serv/RESTRICTED/GEOTRACES/NorthAtlanticTransect/Nd_GT10-11_v8b_joined.html0%7Bdir=data.bco-dmo.org/jg/dir/BCO/GEOTRACES/NorthAtlanticTransect/,info=data.bco-dmo.org/jg/info/BCO/GEOTRACES/NorthAtlanticTransect/Nd_GT10%7D" target="_blank"> KN204-01 (GT11) has restricted</a> access. Please contact the PI for further information.</p> Acquisition Description: <p><strong>Methodology: </strong>A detailed description can be found in Stichel et al. (2015). &nbsp;See the links&nbsp;below for summaries of the described methodology from the paper.</p><p><a href="http://data.bco-dmo.org/GEOTRACES/Pahnke/data_desc_GDAC_Stichel_199-04.pdf" target="_blank">KN199-04 Methodology</a> (pdf)</p><p><a href="http://data.bco-dmo.org/GEOTRACES/Pahnke/data_desc_GDAC_Stichel_204-01.pdf" target="_blank">KN204-01 Methodology</a> (pdf)</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Fig. 1: Sample locations for the Intermediate Data Product.</strong></p><p><a href="http://bcodata.whoi.edu/US_GEOTRACES/AtlanticSection/Pahnke/stations.png" target="_blank"><img alt="" src="http://bcodata.whoi.edu/US_GEOTRACES/AtlanticSection/Pahnke/stations.png" style="width:594px" /></a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>References:</strong>&nbsp;(References listed in the data are codes [1], [2], or [3], corresponding with the following publications/manuscripts)</p><p>[1] Stichel, T., Hartman, A.E., Duggan, B., Goldstein, S.L., Scher, H., Pahnke, K., 2015. Separating biogeochemical cycling of neodymium from water mass mixing in the Eastern North Atlantic. Earth Planet. Sci. Lett. 412, 245–260. doi:10.1016/j.epsl.2014.12.008</p><p>[2] Hartman, A.E., Stichel, T., Duggan, B., Goldstein, S.L., Pahnke, K., Scher, H., Pena, L., in prep. Seawater neodymium composition in the open ocean North Atlantic: water mass signatures and transport.</p><p>[3] Duggan, B., Hartman, A.E., Stichel, T., Goldstein, S.L., Pahnke, K., Bizimis, M., Scher, H., in prep. Neodymium Concentrations and Isotopic Signature of the Deep Western Boundary Current Across Line W</p><p><strong>Table 1: Summary of the procedures applied in the involved laboratories of University of Hawaii at Mano (UH), Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory (LDEO) and University of South Carolina (USC).</strong></p><table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width:502px"><tbody><tr><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Step</span></strong></p></td><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">UH</span></strong></p></td><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">LDEO</span></strong></p></td><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">USC</span></strong></p></td></tr><tr><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Pre-concentration</span></strong></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Spiked with <sup>146</sup>Nd prior to co-precipitation with FeOOH (~20mg Fe per sample)</span></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Spiked with <sup>150</sup>Nd prior to co-precipitation with FeOOH (~20mg Fe per sample)</span></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Nd and REE extraction with C18 cartridges, not spiked</span></p></td></tr><tr><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Chromatographic separation</span></strong></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">2-step separation:<br />1. 1.4ml AG50W-X8 (200-400µm) as primary column. 2. 0.7ml AG50W-X8 (200-400µm) with Alpha-HIBA to purify Nd.<br />3. ~100µl TRU-Spec column for removal of any remaining Alpha-HIBA in samples.</span></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">2-step separation:<br />1. 100µl RE-Spec (100-150µm) as primary column.<br />2. 0.7ml AG50W-X8 (200-400µm) with Alpha-HIBA to purify Nd.</span></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">1-step separation:<br />2ml LN-Spec (50-100µm) for Nd purification. No primary column needed because major ions were removed during pre-concentration</span></p></td></tr><tr><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Mass spectrometry</span></strong></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">VG-Sector TIMS, NdO+, spiked for simultaneous isotope dilution and composition analysis</span></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">VG-Sector54 TIMS, NdO+, spiked for simultaneous isotope dilution and composition analysis </span></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Thermo Neptune Plus MC-ICPMS</span></p></td></tr><tr><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Other</span></strong></p></td><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Concentrations were determined on a previously separated 500ml aliquot by isotope dilution</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0927241 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward.do?AwardNumber=0927241

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Max Planck Research Group for Marine Isotope Geochemistry, ICBM Carl-von-Ossietzky-Str. 9-11
Earth and Ocean Sciences 701 Sumter Street; EWS 617

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: BCO-DMO catalogue of parameters from Seawater Nd isotopes and concentrations from the US-GEOTRACES North Atlantic zonal transect (NAZT), 2010 and 2011 on cruises KN199-04 and KN204-01

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643398.rdf Name: cruise_id Units: unitless Description: Official cruise identifier http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643399.rdf Name: cruise_name Units: unitless Description: agreed nomenclature on cruise section during ODU-GEOTRACES workshop in March 2013 http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643400.rdf Name: station_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: station number; provided in original data submission http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643401.rdf Name: depth_ctd Units: meters Description: sampling depth of CTD; also added are depths of surface sampled by GeoFish. Values provided by PI. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643402.rdf Name: depth_GEOTRC_CTD_round Units: meters Description: sampling depth rounded to nearest meter http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643403.rdf Name: cast_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: cast number http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643404.rdf Name: event_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: event number; provided in original data submission http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643405.rdf Name: date Units: yyyymmdd Description: date of cast; UTC http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643406.rdf Name: time Units: HHMM Description: time of collection; UTC http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643407.rdf Name: sample_bottle_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. nd bottles were from surface GeoFish. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643408.rdf Name: BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.xx][+/-TZ] Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643409.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees Description: latitude; North is positive.Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643410.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees Description: longitude; East is positive.Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643411.rdf Name: sample_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: GEOTRACES sample number; provided in original data submission. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description) and match those provided by PI. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643412.rdf Name: ND_143_ND_144RATIO Units: unitless Description: Observation/sample depth in meters http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643413.rdf Name: ND_143_ND_144_FLAG_W Units: unitless Description: Quality flag: Flag 0: good value; Flag 1: no value or unknown value; Flag 2: replacement considered good value; Flag 4: not trusted; -999: missing value http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643414.rdf Name: int_ND_143_ND_144RATIO Units: unitless Description: ratio of Neodymium isotopes 143/144 http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643415.rdf Name: EPSILON_Nd Units: parts per 10000 Description: final 143Nd/144Nd normalized to 0.512638 (143Nd1/44Nd of the Chondritic Uniform Reservoir in Jacobsen and Wasserburg - 1980) in parts per 10000. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643416.rdf Name: EPSILON_ND_FLAG_W Units: unitless Description: Quality flag: Flag 0: good value; Flag 1: no value or unknown value; Flag 2: replacement considered good value; Flag 4: not trusted; -999: missing value http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643417.rdf Name: EPSILON_ND_2SD Units: parts per 10000 Description: 2 standard deviations of the repeatedly measured standards during the analysis http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643418.rdf Name: diss_Nd_pmol_kg Units: pmol/kg Description: dissolved Nd concentration http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643419.rdf Name: REE_ND_UH_FLAG_W Units: unitless Description: Quality flag: Flag 0: good value; Flag 1: no value or unknown value; Flag 2: replacement considered good value; Flag 4: not trusted; -999: missing value http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643420.rdf Name: LAB Units: unitless Description: the lab group that analyzed the sample: LDEO = Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory: UH = Univ. of Hawaii; USC = Univ. of South Carolina http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643421.rdf Name: Instrument Units: unitless Description: instrument used for analysis: TIMS: Thermal ionization mass spectrometer (VG-Sector (UH) or VG-Sector54 (LDEO)); ICPMS: Multi-Collector Inductively Coupled Mass Spectrometer (NeptunePlus) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/643422.rdf Name: Reference Units: unitless Description: Publication reference; see Description for details

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: GB/NERC/BODC > British Oceanographic Data Centre, Natural Environment Research Council, United Kingdom

gmd:citedResponsibleParty.xlink:title: GB/NERC/BODC > British Oceanographic Data Centre, Natural Environment Research Council, United Kingdom

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/ADATAA01/ Name: Date (UT as yyyymmdd) Description: Unavailable http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/AHMSAA01/ Name: Time (UT as hh24miss) Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z' http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Official cruise identifier; General Description: cruise designation; name

PI-supplied Description: agreed nomenclature on cruise section during ODU-GEOTRACES workshop in March 2013; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.
PI-supplied Description: station number; provided in original data submission; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: sampling depth of CTD; also added are depths of surface sampled by GeoFish. Values provided by PI.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: sampling depth rounded to nearest meter; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.
PI-supplied Description: cast number; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: event number; provided in original data submission; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: date of cast; UTC; General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable

PI-supplied Description: time of collection; UTC; General Description: Time GMT defined as HHMM; time of day; generally reported in GMT as HHMM (hours and minutes) but may also be HH.H (decimal hours) or HHMMSS (hours; minutes and seconds); in EqPac time is reported as Hawaii local time NERC Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. nd bottles were from surface GeoFish. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: latitude; North is positive.Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: longitude; East is positive.Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES sample number; provided in original data submission. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description) and match those provided by PI.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers
PI-supplied Description: Observation/sample depth in meters; General Description: ratio of Neodymium isotopes 143:144.

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag: Flag 0: good value; Flag 1: no value or unknown value; Flag 2: replacement considered good value; Flag 4: not trusted; -999: missing value; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details
PI-supplied Description: ratio of Neodymium isotopes 143/144; General Description: ratio of Neodymium isotopes 143:144.

PI-supplied Description: final 143Nd/144Nd normalized to 0.512638 (143Nd1/44Nd of the Chondritic Uniform Reservoir in Jacobsen and Wasserburg - 1980) in parts per 10000.; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag: Flag 0: good value; Flag 1: no value or unknown value; Flag 2: replacement considered good value; Flag 4: not trusted; -999: missing value; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

PI-supplied Description: 2 standard deviations of the repeatedly measured standards during the analysis; General Description: Generic standard deviation value, taking on the units of the parameter that it is tied to.
PI-supplied Description: dissolved Nd concentration; General Description: Elemental Neodymium concentration

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag: Flag 0: good value; Flag 1: no value or unknown value; Flag 2: replacement considered good value; Flag 4: not trusted; -999: missing value; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

PI-supplied Description: the lab group that analyzed the sample: LDEO = Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory: UH = Univ. of Hawaii; USC = Univ. of South Carolina; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: instrument used for analysis: TIMS: Thermal ionization mass spectrometer (VG-Sector (UH) or VG-Sector54 (LDEO)); ICPMS: Multi-Collector Inductively Coupled Mass Spectrometer (NeptunePlus); General Description: instrument used to collect or process data, definition is specific to the data set in which it appears
PI-supplied Description: Publication reference; see Description for details; General Description: A list of papers referred to as a data column.

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p><strong>Methodology: </strong>A detailed description can be found in Stichel et al. (2015). &nbsp;See the links&nbsp;below for summaries of the described methodology from the paper.</p><p><a href="http://data.bco-dmo.org/GEOTRACES/Pahnke/data_desc_GDAC_Stichel_199-04.pdf" target="_blank">KN199-04 Methodology</a> (pdf)</p><p><a href="http://data.bco-dmo.org/GEOTRACES/Pahnke/data_desc_GDAC_Stichel_204-01.pdf" target="_blank">KN204-01 Methodology</a> (pdf)</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Fig. 1: Sample locations for the Intermediate Data Product.</strong></p><p><a href="http://bcodata.whoi.edu/US_GEOTRACES/AtlanticSection/Pahnke/stations.png" target="_blank"><img alt="" src="http://bcodata.whoi.edu/US_GEOTRACES/AtlanticSection/Pahnke/stations.png" style="width:594px" /></a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>References:</strong>&nbsp;(References listed in the data are codes [1], [2], or [3], corresponding with the following publications/manuscripts)</p><p>[1] Stichel, T., Hartman, A.E., Duggan, B., Goldstein, S.L., Scher, H., Pahnke, K., 2015. Separating biogeochemical cycling of neodymium from water mass mixing in the Eastern North Atlantic. Earth Planet. Sci. Lett. 412, 245–260. doi:10.1016/j.epsl.2014.12.008</p><p>[2] Hartman, A.E., Stichel, T., Duggan, B., Goldstein, S.L., Pahnke, K., Scher, H., Pena, L., in prep. Seawater neodymium composition in the open ocean North Atlantic: water mass signatures and transport.</p><p>[3] Duggan, B., Hartman, A.E., Stichel, T., Goldstein, S.L., Pahnke, K., Bizimis, M., Scher, H., in prep. Neodymium Concentrations and Isotopic Signature of the Deep Western Boundary Current Across Line W</p><p><strong>Table 1: Summary of the procedures applied in the involved laboratories of University of Hawaii at Mano (UH), Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory (LDEO) and University of South Carolina (USC).</strong></p><table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width:502px"><tbody><tr><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Step</span></strong></p></td><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">UH</span></strong></p></td><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">LDEO</span></strong></p></td><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">USC</span></strong></p></td></tr><tr><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Pre-concentration</span></strong></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Spiked with <sup>146</sup>Nd prior to co-precipitation with FeOOH (~20mg Fe per sample)</span></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Spiked with <sup>150</sup>Nd prior to co-precipitation with FeOOH (~20mg Fe per sample)</span></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Nd and REE extraction with C18 cartridges, not spiked</span></p></td></tr><tr><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Chromatographic separation</span></strong></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">2-step separation:<br />1. 1.4ml AG50W-X8 (200-400µm) as primary column. 2. 0.7ml AG50W-X8 (200-400µm) with Alpha-HIBA to purify Nd.<br />3. ~100µl TRU-Spec column for removal of any remaining Alpha-HIBA in samples.</span></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">2-step separation:<br />1. 100µl RE-Spec (100-150µm) as primary column.<br />2. 0.7ml AG50W-X8 (200-400µm) with Alpha-HIBA to purify Nd.</span></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">1-step separation:<br />2ml LN-Spec (50-100µm) for Nd purification. No primary column needed because major ions were removed during pre-concentration</span></p></td></tr><tr><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Mass spectrometry</span></strong></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">VG-Sector TIMS, NdO+, spiked for simultaneous isotope dilution and composition analysis</span></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">VG-Sector54 TIMS, NdO+, spiked for simultaneous isotope dilution and composition analysis </span></p></td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Thermo Neptune Plus MC-ICPMS</span></p></td></tr><tr><td><p><strong><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Other</span></strong></p></td><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td><td><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Concentrations were determined on a previously separated 500ml aliquot by isotope dilution</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><strong>Data Processing:</strong><br />The measured 143Nd/144Nd isotope ratios were normalized to those of the JNdi-1 Nd standard (0.512115, Tanaka et al., 2000). Please see attached methodology files for further information on the data processing.<br /><br /><strong>BCO-DMO Processing Notes:</strong><br />- Added the sample_GEOTRC column by copying the original sample column and removing the '_2' from sample duplicates.<br />- Added Cast_ISO_DateTime_UTC from the original date and time fields.</p><p>SUMMARY OF CORRECTIONS MADE TO SUBMITTED DATA:</p><p>version 8: The data for version 8 (April 2016) completely replaced those from version 7.<br />- The quality flag scheme was changed in accordance with ODV.<br />- New parameters: EPSILON_Nd, EPSILON_ND_FLAG_W, EPSILON_ND_2SD, Instrument, and Reference were added which are described in the documentation.<br />- Column cruise_part was removed.<br />- Version 8b: changed quality flags for KN204-01, stations 3 and 8 from 0 to 2</p><p>- 07 March 2013: Made the following corrections after consulting with dataset scientist:</p><p>KN199-04<br />-- Changed cast number of event 3176 from 2 to 8.<br />-- Changed cast number of event 3169 from 8 to 2.<br />-- Changed event number of KN199-04 station 3 cast 6 from 2059 to 2061.<br />-- Changed event number of KN199-04 station 7 cast 6 from 2107 to 2132.<br />-- Changed event number of KN199-04 station 9 cast 3 from 2059 to 2165.<br />-- Changed event number of KN199-04 station 10 cast 6 from 2191 to 2194.<br />-- Changed event number of KN199-04 station 11 cast 6 from 2206 to 2208.<br />-- Changed bottle number of sample #5393 from 5 to 4 (station 5, cast 6).<br />-- Changed bottle number of sample #5394 from 4 to 3 (station 5, cast 6).<br />-- Changed time of event #2024 from 2129 to 1202.<br /><br />KN204-01<br />-- Changed bottle number of sample #7955 from 8 to 9 (station 22, cast 4).</p><p>Additional data and revisions were served 19 Sept. 2013.</p><p><strong>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:</strong><br />After the data were submitted to the International Data Management Office, BODC, the office noticed that important identifying information was missing in many datasets. With the agreement of BODC and the US GEOTRACES lead PIs, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters: station_GEOTRC, cast_GEOTRC (bottle and pump data only), event_GEOTRC, sample_GEOTRC, sample_bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD_rounded (bottle data only), BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC (bottle data only), and GeoFish_id (GeoFish data only). This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.<br /><br />Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle_GT10, GT-C_Bottle_GT11, ODF_Bottle_GT10, and ODF_Bottle_GT11 datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the Event_Log_GT10 and Event_Log_GT11 datasets. McLane pump cast numbers missing in event logs were taken from the Particulate Th-234 dataset submitted by Ken Buesseler.<br /><br />A standardized BCO-DMO method (called "join") was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters.<br /><br />If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.<br /><br />See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: Niskin bottle PI Supplied Instrument Description:30L Niskin bottles with Nylon-coated internal stainless steel springs and Viton o-rings, mounted on a powder-coated aluminum frame. Instrument Name: Niskin bottle Instrument Short Name:Niskin bottle Instrument Description: A Niskin bottle (a next generation water sampler based on the Nansen bottle) is a cylindrical, non-metallic water collection device with stoppers at both ends. The bottles can be attached individually on a hydrowire or deployed in 12, 24 or 36 bottle Rosette systems mounted on a frame and combined with a CTD. Niskin bottles are used to collect discrete water samples for a range of measurements including pigments, nutrients, plankton, etc. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL0412/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: CTD Sea-Bird PI Supplied Instrument Description:SeaBird CTD, oxygen, fluorescence and transmissometer sensors were attached to the frame in stainless steel or anodized aluminum housings. Instrument Name: CTD Sea-Bird Instrument Short Name:CTD Sea-Bird Instrument Description: Conductivity, Temperature, Depth (CTD) sensor package from SeaBird Electronics, no specific unit identified. This instrument designation is used when specific make and model are not known. See also other SeaBird instruments listed under CTD. More information from Sea-Bird Electronics. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/130/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: GeoFish Instrument Name: GeoFish Towed near-Surface Sampler Instrument Short Name:GeoFish Instrument Description: The GeoFish towed sampler is a custom designed near surface (<2m) sampling system for the collection of trace metal clean seawater. It consists of a PVC encapsulated lead weighted torpedo and separate PVC depressor vane supporting the intake utilizing all PFA Teflon tubing connected to a deck mounted, air-driven, PFA Teflon dual-diaphragm pump which provides trace-metal clean seawater at up to 3.7L/min. The GeoFish is towed at up to 13kts off to the side of the vessel outside of the ship's wake to avoid possible contamination from the ship's hull. It was developed by Geoffrey Smith and Ken Bruland (University of California, Santa Cruz). Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/31/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Mass Spectrometer PI Supplied Instrument Description:Neodymium was measured as NdO+ on a VG TIMS Sector ( at UH) and VG TIMS Sector54 ( at LDEO). At USC, the Nd isotope composition was measured on a Thermo Neptune Plus MC-ICPMS. Instrument Name: Mass Spectrometer Instrument Short Name:Mass Spec Instrument Description: General term for instruments used to measure the mass-to-charge ratio of ions; generally used to find the composition of a sample by generating a mass spectrum representing the masses of sample components. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/LAB16/

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
